result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:41 p.m.  Inducement of 9/20/22.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  11/11/22, 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
James McLinden, for Public Defender

10:52 a.m.  Public Defender unable to find counsel to represent defendant.  Good cause found to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 9/21/22, 1:30 p.m., Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:43 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steve L. Shimek in court.  Attorney Ann Larson appearing with the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-28-22 at 10:30 a.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:24 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steve Shimek appearing in person.  Attorney Nathan Heim appearing in person for the defendant. More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.

Initial appearance is reset to 05-23-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel. 
Minutes.

Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steve L. Shimek in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Steve L. Shimek. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  
Initial appearance reset to 04-25-2022 at 1:30pm.

Prior: 909 S 26Th St A, Manitowoc, WI 54220

RE:  Battery-dvo-domestic abuse repeater, on 04-04-22.
Order for Prints.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 04-05-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-14-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with T.A.M., DOB: 06-14-1972 and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs. Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
